title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: ReVAMP provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London’s Centre Digital Music. Vamp plugins widely used Music Information Retrieval (MIR) tasks including: Tempo beat detection Onset detection Pitch tracking Spectral analysis Audio feature extraction Chord detection Key detection

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: ReVAMP requires Vamp plugins installed separately. Popular plugin collections include: Vamp Example Plugins - Basic examples QM Vamp Plugins - Queen Mary plugins Vamp Aubio Plugins - Aubio feature extractors See Vamp Paths vignette details plugin installation search paths.

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: First, check plugins available system: dataframe contains: library - plugin library name id - plugin identifier name - Human-readable plugin name description - Plugin description maker - Plugin author category - Plugin category
code: # List all available plugins plugins <- vampPlugins() head(plugins)  # View plugin information str(plugins)

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: main function runPlugin(), executes plugin audio data returns results named list data frames. output data frame contains: timestamp - Time feature (seconds frames) duration - Duration feature (applicable) value - Feature value(s) list column label - Text label (provided plugin)
code: # Load audio file audio <- readWave("path/to/audio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower plugin result <- runPlugin(   key = "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower",   wave = audio,   params = NULL,      # Use default parameters   useFrames = FALSE   # Return timestamps in seconds )  # Result is a named list of data frames (one per output) names(result) str(result[[1]])

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: Plugins identified key format library:plugin:
code: # Examples of plugin keys "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower" "vamp-aubio:aubiotempo" "qm-vamp-plugins:qm-tempotracker" "nnls-chroma:chordino"

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: Many plugins accept parameters customize behavior.

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: parameters dataframe shows: identifier - Parameter name use code name - Human-readable name description - parameter controls unit - Unit measurement minValue, maxValue - Valid range defaultValue - Default setting isQuantized - Whether discrete values quantizeStep - Step size quantized parameters valueNames - Named values (quantized parameters)
code: # Get parameters for a plugin params_df <- vampPluginParams("vamp-aubio:aubiopitch") print(params_df)

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: Pass parameters named list:
code: # Run pitch detection with custom parameters result <- runPlugin(   key = "vamp-aubio:aubiopitch",   wave = audio,   params = list(     maxfreq = 800,      # Maximum frequency in Hz     minfreq = 100,      # Minimum frequency in Hz     silencethreshold = -70  # Silence threshold in dB   ),   useFrames = FALSE )

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: Package documentation: ?ReVAMP, ?runPlugin Plugin information: vampPlugins(), vampPluginParams() Vamp website: https://www.vamp-plugins.org/ Package issues: https://github.com/edwbaker/ReVAMP/issues

title: Introduction to ReVAMP
text: Cannam, C., Landone, C., & Sandler, M. (2010). Sonic Visualiser: open source application viewing, analysing, annotating music audio files. Proceedings 18th ACM International Conference Multimedia, 1467-1468. Vamp Plugins: https://www.vamp-plugins.org/

title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: Vamp plugins distributed separate binary libraries ReVAMP loads runtime. Understanding Vamp finds plugins important : Installing new plugins Troubleshooting missing plugins Managing multiple plugin versions Deploying applications use ReVAMP vignette covers plugin search paths, installation locations, troubleshooting.

title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: Use vampPaths() see ReVAMP searches plugins: returns character vector directories searched order. ReVAMP find first matching plugin list.
code: # View plugin search paths paths <- vampPaths() print(paths)

title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: Search paths vary operating system:

previous_headings: Plugin Search Paths > Default Search Paths
title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: ~/Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Vamp (user plugins) /Library/Audio/Plug-Ins/Vamp (system plugins)

previous_headings: Plugin Search Paths > Default Search Paths
title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: ~/.vamp (user plugins) /usr/local/lib/vamp (locally installed) /usr/lib/vamp (system packages)

previous_headings: Plugin Search Paths > Default Search Paths
title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: %APPDATA%\Vamp Plugins (user plugins) C:\Program Files\Vamp Plugins (users) C:\Program Files (x86)\Vamp Plugins (32-bit 64-bit)

title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: can add custom plugin directories using VAMP_PATH environment variable:

previous_headings: Plugin Search Paths > Custom Search Paths
title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
code: # In ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc export VAMP_PATH=$HOME/my-vamp-plugins:/opt/vamp-plugins  # Or for single R session Sys.setenv(VAMP_PATH = "/path/to/plugins:/another/path")

previous_headings: Plugin Search Paths > Custom Search Paths
title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: Path separator : Unix/macOS ; Windows.
code: # PowerShell (persistent) [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable("VAMP_PATH",    "C:\MyPlugins;D:\MorePlugins", "User")  # Or in R session Sys.setenv(VAMP_PATH = "C:\\MyPlugins;D:\\MorePlugins")

title: Managing Vamp Plugin Paths
text: installing plugins, verify ’re detected:
code: # List all plugins plugins <- vampPlugins()  # View plugin details plugin_info <- plugins[plugins$id == "vamp-aubio:aubiotempo", ] print(plugin_info)

what: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London’s Centre Digital Music. enables R users load run Vamp plugins tasks like tempo detection, onset detection, spectral analysis, feature extraction.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Comprehensive Plugin Support: Access 100+ Vamp plugins audio analysis Data Frame Output: Results returned R data frames easy analysis visualization

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Install source: install devtools:
code: # Install dependencies install.packages(c("Rcpp", "tuneR"))  # Install ReVAMP install.packages("path/to/ReVAMP_1.0.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type = "source") devtools::install_github("edwbaker/ReVAMP")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP requires external Vamp plugins installed.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
code: library(ReVAMP) library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower and get results as data frame result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower",   useFrames = FALSE  # Use timestamps in seconds )  # Examine results str(result) #> List of 1 #>  $ amplitude:'data.frame':   1292 obs. of  4 variables: #>   ..$ timestamp: num [1:1292] 0 0.023 0.046 0.07 0.093 ... #>   ..$ duration : num [1:1292] NA NA NA NA NA ... #>   ..$ value    : num [1:1292] 22866 22896 22735 22531 22380 ... #>   ..$ label    : chr [1:1292] "" "" "" "" ...  # Plot amplitude over time plot(result$amplitude$timestamp, result$amplitude$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Amplitude",      main = "Audio Amplitude")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Detect note onsets audio:
code: onsets <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset",   useFrames = FALSE )  # View onset times print(onsets$onsets$timestamp)  # Plot onsets on waveform plot(audio) abline(v = onsets$onsets$timestamp * audio@samp.rate, col = "red", lty = 2)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Estimate tempo (BPM):
code: tempo <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubiotempo",   useFrames = FALSE )  cat("Estimated tempo:", mean(tempo$tempo$value), "BPM\n")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Analyze spectral characteristics:
code: centroid <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-example-plugins:spectralcentroid",   useFrames = FALSE )  plot(centroid$logcentroid$timestamp, centroid$logcentroid$value, type = "l",      xlab = "Time (s)", ylab = "Log Centroid",      main = "Spectral Centroid Over Time")

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
code: # Get Vamp API/SDK version info vampInfo()  # List plugin search paths vampPaths()  # List all installed plugins with details plugins <- vampPlugins() View(plugins)  # Get parameters for a specific plugin params <- vampPluginParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") View(params)

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: ReVAMP consists three layers: Vamp Plugin SDK (inst/vamp/): C++ libraries defining Vamp plugin interface Vamp Host SDK (src/Plugin*.cpp): C++ host implementation loads manages plugins R Interface (src/R_host.cpp): Rcpp bindings exposing functionality R Key features: - PluginLoader: Discovers loads Vamp plugins system directories - Plugin Adapters: Automatically handle channel mixing, domain conversion (time/frequency), buffering - DataFrame Output: Collects features memory returns structured data R

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: Input: tuneR::Wave S4 objects R Conversion: Extracted float buffers C++ Processing: Fed block--block Vamp plugins automatic adaptation Output: Collected memory returned DataFrame R Optional File: Can also write CSV file outfilename provided

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins
text: package uses standard R/Rcpp development tools:
code: library(devtools)  # Make changes to code...  # Regenerate documentation roxygen2::roxygenise()  # Install locally install()  # Run tests test()  # Run R CMD check check()

what: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Provides R interface Vamp audio analysis plugin system developed Queen Mary University London's Centre Digital Music. Enables loading running Vamp plugins Music Information Retrieval (MIR) tasks including tempo detection, onset detection, spectral analysis, audio feature extraction.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: ReVAMP package allows R users access extensive library Vamp audio analysis plugins. Key functions include: vampPlugins - List available Vamp plugins runPlugin - Execute plugin audio data vampPluginParams - Get plugin parameter information vampPaths - List plugin search paths vampInfo - Get Vamp SDK version information See individual function documentation usage examples.

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Name Maintainer: Name <@email.com>

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
text: Vamp Plugins: https://www.vamp-plugins.org/ Cannam, C., Landone, C., & Sandler, M. (2010). Sonic Visualiser: open source application viewing, analysing, annotating music audio files. Proceedings 18th ACM international conference Multimedia (pp. 1467-1468).

title: R Interface to Vamp Audio Analysis Plugins — ReVAMP-package
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List available plugins plugins <- vampPlugins() head(plugins)  # Get plugin search paths vampPaths()  # Get info about a specific plugin params <- vampParams("vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower")  # Get SDK version information vampInfo() } # }

what: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Executes Vamp audio analysis plugin Wave object returns outputs produced plugin. main function performing audio feature extraction analysis.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: runPlugin(   wave,   key,   params = NULL,   useFrames = FALSE,   blockSize = NULL,   stepSize = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: wave Wave object tuneR package containing audio data analyze, character string specifying path WAV file. Using file path avoids loading entire audio file R memory, can efficient large files. Can mono stereo. key Character string specifying plugin "library:plugin" format (e.g., "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower", "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset"). Use vampPlugins see available plugins keys. params Optional named list parameter values configure plugin. Parameter names must match parameter identifiers vampPluginParams. Values coerced numeric. NULL (default), plugin default parameter values used. useFrames Logical indicating whether use frame numbers (TRUE) timestamps (FALSE) output. Default FALSE. blockSize Optional integer specifying analysis block size samples. NULL (default), plugin's preferred block size used. frequency domain plugins, determines FFT size frequency resolution. Larger values give better frequency resolution worse time resolution. stepSize Optional integer specifying step size (hop size) samples successive analysis blocks. NULL (default), plugin's preferred step size used. frequency domain plugins, defaults blockSize/2. Smaller values give better time resolution increase computation time. verbose Logical indicating whether print progress messages diagnostic information plugin execution. Default FALSE quiet operation.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: named list data frames, one output produced plugin. names correspond output identifiers (e.g., "amplitude", "onsets"). data frame contains columns timestamp (frame), duration, values, labels (applicable). plugin one output, list one element.

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
text: Many Vamp plugins produce multiple outputs. example, onset detector might output "onsets" (discrete event times) "detection_function" (continuous measure). function returns outputs, allowing access whichever ones need. plugin automatically adapt audio characteristics: Channel mixing/augmentation plugin requirements differ input Time/frequency domain conversion needed Buffering handle different block sizes Block Size Step Size: parameters control time/frequency resolution trade-: blockSize: Size analysis window. frequency domain plugins, FFT size. Typical values: 512, 1024, 2048, 4096. Larger = better frequency resolution, worse time resolution. stepSize: Number samples advance blocks (hop size). Typical values: blockSize/2 (50\ Smaller = better time resolution, computation. output data frame typically includes: timestamp: Time frame number feature duration: Duration feature (applicable, otherwise NA) value/value1/value2/...: Feature values (number columns varies) label: Text label feature (applicable, otherwise empty) function supports three Vamp output sample types: OneSamplePerStep: Regular intervals based step size FixedSampleRate: Output fixed rate (may differ input) VariableSampleRate: Sparse output irregular intervals

title: Run a Vamp Plugin on Audio Data — runPlugin
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(tuneR)  # Load audio file audio <- readWave("myaudio.wav")  # Run amplitude follower plugin - returns list with one output result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-example-plugins:amplitudefollower" )  # Access the amplitude output amplitude_data <- result$amplitude head(amplitude_data)  # Run onset detection - may return multiple outputs result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset" )  # See what outputs were produced names(result)  # Access specific outputs onsets <- result$onsets detection_fn <- result$detection_function  # Run plugin with custom parameters # First check what parameters are available params_info <- vampPluginParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") print(params_info)  # Set specific parameter values result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset",   params = list(threshold = 0.5, silence = -70) )  # Run with custom block and step sizes for better time resolution result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset",   blockSize = 512,   # Smaller blocks for better time resolution   stepSize = 128     # 75% overlap for smoother detection )  # Run frequency domain plugin with larger FFT for better frequency resolution result <- runPlugin(   wave = audio,   key = "qm-vamp-plugins:qm-chromagram",   blockSize = 4096,  # Larger FFT for better frequency resolution   stepSize = 2048    # 50% overlap (typical for frequency domain) ) } # }

what: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
text: Returns information Vamp API SDK versions used ReVAMP.

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
code: vampInfo()

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
text: list two elements: API version Integer indicating Vamp API version (typically 2) SDK version Character string indicating Vamp SDK version (e.g., "2.10")

title: Get Vamp API and SDK Version Information — vampInfo
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get version information vampInfo() } # }

what: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
text: Returns list directories ReVAMP searches Vamp plugins. search paths determined Vamp Host SDK typically include system-wide plugin directories user-specific directories.

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
code: vampPaths()

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
text: character vector directory paths

title: Get Vamp Plugin Search Paths — vampPaths
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List plugin search paths vampPaths() } # }

what: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
text: Returns detailed information configurable parameters given Vamp plugin. Parameters can adjusted customize plugin behavior.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
code: vampPluginParams(key)

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
text: key Character string specifying plugin key "library:plugin" format (e.g., "vamp-aubio-plugins:aubionotes"). Use vampPlugins get plugin IDs.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
text: data frame one row per parameter columns including: identifier Parameter identifier name Human-readable parameter name description Parameter description unit Unit measurement (applicable) min_value Minimum allowed value max_value Maximum allowed value default_value Default value quantized Logical indicating parameter quantized discrete values Returns empty data frame plugin configurable parameters.

title: Get Parameters for a Specific Vamp Plugin — vampPluginParams
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get parameters for aubio onset detector params <- vampPluginParams("vamp-aubio-plugins:aubioonset") } # }

what: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
text: Enumerates Vamp plugins found plugin search paths returns detailed information plugin including metadata, parameters, audio processing requirements.

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
code: vampPlugins()

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
text: data frame one row per plugin columns including: library Plugin library name (without extension) name Human-readable plugin name id Unique plugin identifier (library:plugin format) plugin.version Plugin version number vamp.api.version Vamp API version plugin uses maker Plugin author/creator copyright Copyright information description Detailed plugin description input.domain Input domain: "Time Domain" "Frequency Domain" default.step.size Default step size samples default.block.size Default block size samples minimum.channels Minimum number audio channels required maximum.channels Maximum number audio channels supported

title: List All Available Vamp Plugins — vampPlugins
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all installed plugins plugins <- vampPlugins()  # Filter for specific library aubio_plugins <- plugins[plugins$library == "vamp-aubio-plugins", ] } # }

title: ReVAMP 1.0
text: Preview release.
